DOC.brief_summary: A study to evaluate rizatriptan for the treatment of multiple attacks of acute migraine compared to placebo.
DOC.brief_title: Treatment of Multiple Attacks of Acute Migraine (0462-025)
DOC.criteria: Patient had at least a 6month history of migraine, with or without aura Patient was male, or if female must have been postmenopausal, surgically sterilized, or taking adequate contraceptive precautions. Patient was judged to be in good health, apart from migraine Patient was pregnant or a nursing mother. Patient had abused drugs or alcohol within 12 months prior to entering the study Patient had a history of cardiovascular disease Patient had clinically significant ECG abnormality Patient had a resting systolic blood pressure of greater than 145 mm Hg or diastolic of less than 95 mm Hg at screening Patient received treatment with an investigational device or compound within 30 days of the study start Patient typically suffered from less then 1 or more than 8 attacks of migraine per month Patient had difficulty in distinguishing his/her migraine attacks from tension or interval headaches Patient had prior exposure to rizatriptan
